text: skip a trip to the candy store and make
your own decadent white chocolate
raspberry clusters at home it's only
three ingredients it couldn't be more
simple and they come out beautifully
pink they're really fun for Valentine's
Day so ten ounces of white chocolate
this is just melted in the microwave it
takes maybe a minute or two just stir to
make sure all the little lumps are out
and then for the crunchy bits
three-quarters of a cup of a crisp rice
cereal this unbelievably stays crunchy
even when it goes in the refrigerator it
really is so good I love this
combination with white chocolate but you
could make this with a dark chocolate or
a milk chocolate you just won't get that
great pink color if you do it comes from
freeze dried raspberries these are just
raspberries nothing else but they've
been dried so they're nice and crunchy
and the red color is really brilliant
so I've chopped them up and they go
right in here half of a cup this adds
such a great tang to these rich white
chocolate clusters and this great pink
color and that's it those are our three
ingredients so if this mixture is
feeling kind of loose you can let it sit
just to thicken up the chocolate a
little bit as it thickens it'll form
kind of tighter clusters otherwise
they'll be rather loose so you can just
play with it put it in the fridge for a
minute if you want to get it a little
bit tighter I like to use an ice cream
scoop to get them nice and even so just
scoop them make little mounds you can
make them as big or as small as you want
I could either be a 1 by a 2 bite or 3
right so these will go into the
refrigerator to set up about 30 minutes
and they'll be nice and firm and you can
keep them in the refrigerator for up to
5 days or a week they'll hold
beautifully and then you can box them up
forgiving I'm gonna keep scooping and
I'll get these into the fridge our white
chocolate raspberry clusters are all
firm and now we can pick them up I'm
gonna put them right in these cupcake
liners in this pretty box this is gonna
make a delicious and very beautiful gift
for someone special and you can make a
double batch of these and make two big
boxes or save some for yourself and
that's that all ready to go once they've
been in the fridge they can stay out at
a cool room temperature and they'll be
fine otherwise keep this box in the
fridge until you're ready to give them
they look so good and what a great
looking gift that is and great for
someone special
you
